tool.name: Personal Cancer Genome Reporter
tool.command:
ln -s '$input' input.vcf.gz && ln -s '$input.metadata.tabix_index' input.vcf.gz.tbi &&
pcgr --input_vcf input.vcf.gz --pcgr_dir \$GALAXY_PCGR_DIR --output_dir ./ --genome_assembly $genome_assembly --sample_id "galaxy_sample" --assay "WGS" --vcf2maf --no_docker ## is needed for Docker ;)
&&
ls -l
&&
gunzip galaxy_sample.pcgr_acmg.grch37.pass.tsv.gz

param.name: input
param.label: Sample data in compressed VCF format

data.name: rmarkdown_html
data.label: An interactive HTML report for clinical interpretation (rmarkdown)

data.name: flexdashboard_html
data.label: An interactive HTML report for clinical interpretation (flexdashboard)

data.name: rich_annotation_vcf
data.label: VCF with rich set of annotations for precision oncology

data.name: rich_annotation_tabular
data.label: Tabular with rich set of annotations for precision oncology

data.name: snvs_indel_tiers
data.label: Variants organized according to tiers of functional relevance

data.name: mutational_signatures
data.label: annotations of gene transcripts that overlap with somatic copy number aberrations

tool.help: The Personal Cancer Genome Reporter (PCGR) is a doing functional annotation and translation of individual tumor genomes for precision cancer medicine. It interprets both somatic SNVs/InDels and copy number aberrations. PCGR extends basic gene and variant annotations from the Ensemblâ€™s Variant Effect Predictor (VEP) with oncology-relevant, up-to-date annotations retrieved flexibly through vcfanno. Variants are further classified into tiers of clinical significance. Interactive HTML output reports allow the user to interrogate the clinical impact of the molecular findings in an individual tumor.
